intro: Psychotria sidamensis, commonly known as the Sidamensis Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It is often found in humid, lowland forests and is known for its ornamental value. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
